CommentsContent: Dixie To Go Hot Beverage Cups and Lids are an excellent idea to have on hand, in case you’re running late and don’t have access to a reusable thermos. I’m able to enjoy my coffee at a reasonable rate without having to gun it down before it gets cold; that’s one of the reasons I use thermal, disposable cups versus reusable, ceramic mugs. I don't particularly appreciate having to rush through a cup of coffee or tea.2. The plastic lid prevents the contents from spilling, which I appreciate since I’m relatively clumsy.3. Each cup contains a funny, unique saying that puts a smile on my face.Cons:1. These cups do not have a sleeve to protect your hand, which surprised me since that’s the norm. It seems easy enough to include a cardboard sleeve that you can grip while holding your beverage. Unlike foam, which isn’t recyclable but keeps your drinks hot without burning your hands, these cups transfer a tremendous amount of heat, and within seconds your palm is in pain.2. These are technically recyclable, but that depends upon where you live.If you don’t have any nerve endings in your hands, then I suggest you try Dixie to Go Hot Beverage Cups and Lids. But if you’re like me and can still feel the heat, then I don’t recommend these cups unless they include a cardboard sleeve in future packages.
